projects.shortDes: To put my web-dev skills to the test, I created this personal website. No online templates, everything you see here is from scratch. Enjoy!
projects.longerDes: I developed this web-app with Javascript and React, styled it with CSS, and deployed it with Netlify.

projects.title: Automated VAR
projects.caption: The end result of our program: two lines that'll determine whether attacking player is offsides
projects.caption1: Using k-means to determine which team a player is on
projects.caption2: Using Houghline Transformations to identify the goal-line
projects.shortDes: For my High School Senior Project, I created a fully automated system that can determine whether a soccer player is offsides from a video of play.
projects.longerDes: Check out my Github Repository if you'd like to see a more detailed explanation on how I did this. But anyways, I first used yolov5's common object detection model to detect all the players. I then used Image Segmentation and k-means to grab the color of all the players' jerseys so that I could figure out the attackers and defenders. Next, I trained a custom model myself that can track the ball in the video so that I can find the exact moment the attacking player passes the ball. Finally, I use Hough-Line Transformations to find the goal-line so that my program can draw the offsides lines parallel to the goal-line.
